Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp

Class SimpleRelayHandlerFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.SimpleRelayHandlerFactory
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ClientConnectedFactory
    public class SimpleRelayHandlerFactory
extends java.lang.Object
implements ClientConnectedFactory
    Factory that creates SimpleRelayHandler instances.

    This factory manages a shared DNS resolver for MX lookups and creates handler instances for each incoming connection. The DNS resolver uses system-configured nameservers by default.

    Configuration

    
 <server id="smtp" class="org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.SMTPServer">
     <property name="port">25</property>
     <property name="client-connected-factory">org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.SimpleRelayHandlerFactory</property>
 </server>

    Optional Properties

    • hostname - Local hostname for EHLO (default: system hostname)
    • dns-server - DNS server address (default: system resolvers)
    • dns-timeout - DNS query timeout in milliseconds (default: 5000)
    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    SimpleRelayHandler

      • createHandler

        public ClientConnected createHandler()
        Description copied from interface: ClientConnectedFactory
        Creates a new handler for an incoming client connection.

        This is called once per connection. The returned handler receives the initial ClientConnected.connected(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.ConnectionInfo, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.smtp.handler.ConnectedState) callback and manages the connection's lifecycle.

        Specified by:
        createHandler in interface ClientConnectedFactory
        Returns:
        a new handler instance

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes the factory and releases resources. Call this when shutting down the server.
